message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.Distributed, cs.CC, cs.SY. 

The paper presents new protocols for Byzantine state machine replication and Byzantine agreement, which are topics related to distributed computing and cryptography. Therefore, cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions the improvement of cryptographic protocols such as secure multiparty computation and cryptocurrencies, which further supports the relevance to cs.CR. The paper also utilizes the synchrony assumption, which is a topic related to the design and analysis of distributed algorithms, making cs.Distributed a likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the reduction of the number of rounds required for synchronous authenticated Byzantine agreement, which is a topic related to computational complexity, making cs.CC (Computational Complexity) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper introduces a notion of virtual participation after termination, which is a topic related to control systems and optimization, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category.
